rev.desc.rev.desc: Add the ability to pass in a filename to the wizard.
panel: use.datadict

updated the expression on this panel to take into consideration fields within structures (header,x : middle,x ... etc). Since the datadicts no longer contain the structure portion the code was not finding the fields in the datadict and therefore was not generating the correct labels.
corrected issue where positioning of fields was being ignored. $L.position was not being initialized.
added the following to the start panel: $L.position={}
Added additional control for form sizes and column positioning.
Further modification for CenterPoint Task 19778 for Request 4433:
Changed made so that when a call is made to macro.build.field.array, it uses the panel called run.formsdesign.
Modification for CenterPoint Task 19778 for Request 4433:

Changed this RAD application so that the Forms Designer wizard will bring in fields that are nested within structures. Prior to this change, Forms Designer was only bringing in fields at level 1 (the topmost level).
See CenterPoint Task 19778 for Request 4433 for details of what was done.
Case insensitivity problem fixes.
Will not set the file name if designing a format used to display a list of records.
Put back in old field selection logic. Changing to use macro.build.field.array was a mistake.
Use apm.choose.add.format to prompt for format name.
Use macro.build.field.array to generate the list of fields.
wouldn't use caption for first field alphabetically
Added scmsg function for internationalization of messages.
now passes $L.controls properly into us.build.format
Change to set all columns in a qbe list to have a button id of 1000
Added two options to set all to false or true.
Now properly returns the form name to forms.designer if the user has to select the name inside the wizard
Only include fields marked as true by the user.
Now prompts a bit more nicely for what type of format to create
Now support generation of tables
Touched up the combo box property string

descript.descript: Add the ability to pass in a filename to the wizard.
panel: use.datadict

updated the expression on this panel to take into consideration fields within structures (header,x : middle,x ... etc). Since the datadicts no longer contain the structure portion the code was not finding the fields in the datadict and therefore was not generating the correct labels.
corrected issue where positioning of fields was being ignored. $L.position was not being initialized.
added the following to the start panel: $L.position={}
Added additional control for form sizes and column positioning.
Further modification for CenterPoint Task 19778 for Request 4433:
Changed made so that when a call is made to macro.build.field.array, it uses the panel called run.formsdesign.
Modification for CenterPoint Task 19778 for Request 4433:

Changed this RAD application so that the Forms Designer wizard will bring in fields that are nested within structures. Prior to this change, Forms Designer was only bringing in fields at level 1 (the topmost level).
See CenterPoint Task 19778 for Request 4433 for details of what was done.
Case insensitivity problem fixes.
Will not set the file name if designing a format used to display a list of records.
Put back in old field selection logic. Changing to use macro.build.field.array was a mistake.
Use apm.choose.add.format to prompt for format name.
Use macro.build.field.array to generate the list of fields.
wouldn't use caption for first field alphabetically
Added scmsg function for internationalization of messages.
now passes $L.controls properly into us.build.format
Change to set all columns in a qbe list to have a button id of 1000
Added two options to set all to false or true.
Now properly returns the form name to forms.designer if the user has to select the name inside the wizard
Only include fields marked as true by the user.
Now prompts a bit more nicely for what type of format to create
Now support generation of tables
Touched up the combo box property string
